text:
"I shan’t imagine anything," she said.

"Call her in. I won’t be in your way."

Five minutes later, Sonia entered, shy and surprised. 

Pyotr Petrovitch greeted her with a smirk. 

"Sit down," he urged, motioning to the chair.

Sonia glanced nervously at the notes on the table. 

"Is Raskolnikov here?" he whispered to Lebeziatnikov.

"Yes, he just came in."

"Stay with us. I need a few words with her."

Lebeziatnikov nodded, understanding the tension. 

Sonia’s eyes remained fixed on Pyotr Petrovitch.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Pyotr Petrovitch expresses his desire to speak privately with Sonia while ensuring Raskolnikov does not overhear their conversation.
